results.title: Editing
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to editing the newly processed film with examples of the right and wrong way. First extract and discard unwanted material and adjust the general order, then edit to preserve continuity of movement by cutting an action matching action or the use of cut aways; continuity with static subjects and editing to create contrast and impact; importance of tempo.

group_siblings.title: The Fundamentals of film making. No.1: learning the language
The Fundamentals of film making - No.2: using the camera

results.title: The Fundamentals of film making - No.2: using the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to moving picture camera use; loading, running off leader and how to avoid fogging; how to keep the camera steady and use of a tripod; panning and common faults to avoid; the use of the zoom and the need for restraint; placing of the camera and avoidance of the jump cut; pitfalls of reverse action and parallax.

group_siblings.title: The Fundamentals of film making. No.1: learning the language

results.title: The Fundamentals of film making. No.1: learning the language
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to moving picture photography using the written word in an analogy with the completed film: how a succession of single frames, equivalent of a letter in a single word, gives an impression of continuous movement; the definition and examples of a “shot” likening it to a word in a sentence; then the “sequence” equivalent of a paragraph or chapter, depending on length. The purpose terms used and results achieved when camera angles are varied and the camera moved, and the effect of varying the time scale. How to make basic transitions (cut, fade, mix) from shot to shot.

results.title: The Treasure hunt: teamwork
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
Presents a puppet show story about teamwork on a treasure hunt in order to show the value of working together to meet a common goal.

results.title: Taffy's imagination: fear of the dark
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
One of a series of six Forest Town Fables, this film presents realistic explanations of imagined fantasies, so that darkness can be faced with confidence. It explains that Taffy is afraid of the dark until her puppet friends teach her their night game. It also shows how she discovers that things she saw and heard were imagined. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Magic scarab: superstition
results.creator_credit: Marshall Izen and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
This film uses a puppet story to explore the fallacy of belief in superstition, emphasizing self-reliance. It shows how Oni and the other puppets find out whether or not a good-luck charm really works when Oni reluctantly enters the spelling contest without it. Awards: two Emmy awards. Voices by Ruth Franklin and Marshall Izen. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Great piggy-bank raid: Honesty
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
Presents the Forest Town puppet friends in an adventure in which they learn a lesson in honesty when they try to raise enough money to buy uniforms for their band concert.

results.title: Shape
results.creator_credit: Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Discusses shape as one of the basic elements of design, and its function in the art and industry of everyday life. Shows the effects achieved by use of circles, squares, rectangles, triangles, and their various combinations
